body.name: Fool Me Once
body.description: A widowed veteran gets the shock of her life in this impossible-to-put-down thriller from the bestselling author and creator of the hit Netflix drama The Stranger.In the course of eight consecutive #1 New York Times bestsellers, millions of readers have discovered Harlan Coben’s page-turning thrillers, filled with his trademark edge-of-your-seat suspense and gut-wrenching emotion. In Fool Me Once, Coben once again outdoes himself....Former special ops pilot Maya, home from the war, sees an unthinkable image captured by her nanny cam while she is at work: her two-year-old daughter playing with Maya’s husband, Joe - who was brutally murdered two weeks earlier. The provocative question at the heart of the mystery: Can you believe everything you see with your own eyes, even when you desperately want to? To find the answer, Maya must finally come to terms with deep secrets and deceit in her own past before she can face the unbelievable truth about her husband - and herself. Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fool Me Once
reviews.reviewText: This is the first Harlan Coben book that I have read. I have watched many of the Netflix movies based off of his novels and I have to say that I am a fan! I hope to read more books by this author. This book has a lot of twists and turns with a lot of family drama, murders & corruption. If you like a good mystery you will enjoy this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Much different from the show
reviews.reviewText: The show was honestly much better, but I do recommend giving the book a shot! The overall concept was the same but a lot of the in between was salaciously and wildly different!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I didn't want to put the book down. I'm usually pretty good at figuring things out, this one surprised me until the very end. Highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Book looks tampered with
reviews.reviewText: Aside the story, just rating the condition of the book since I bought new. Came with a sticker half ripped off (I mean okay no big deal I just had to carefully buff out what was remaining). Also there is this stained red line at the base of the book. Almost looks like blood. And I don’t thing it’s part of the story. But please correct me if I’m wrong. I was hoping for a clean conditioned book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This actually wasn’t what I was expecting. If I’m being honest I was upset because it just wasn’t the story I was expecting it to be and the ending left me a little let down.However- that being said- I went into it thinking the book had a completely different storyline. I already had an idea of what would happen and when it didn’t- I was disappointed. I wish I didn’t have pre-conceived ideas of it because all together it really was a good book!I think the storyline keeps you on yours toes the whole time with a few shocking “whaaaat” moments in there too! Overall, I think this book was very well written- very well thought out, and executed! I would 100% recommend this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Interesting story. Read it after seeing the movie. I think the books location makes more sense. I different story but it fits our time. Nice ending!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Only A Fool
reviews.reviewText: This book has so many twists and turns that it kept me guessing again and again. I loved it. It took me down so many different paths that it fooled me more than once. A fun, fast moving book. Highly recommended it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This one was not a fast read for me like some other Coben books- however, I've had a lot going on and I loved the ending, especially the epilogue. So I would strongly recommend this one if you love military protagonists, strong women, creepy rich families, and the typical Coben twists!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’m pretty new to this author’s books which is a shocker I know. I’ve been binge watching the Netflix show’s of his stories, this one included and loved them that much, I had to buy some of his books as well.Even though I had watched the show and knew how it all plays out, it does differ slightly in that the detective’s role in the book is much more smaller. Other than that, it was surprisingly very similar. A lot of films/shows cut lots out or change a lot of things but I think they did a great job on this one.Enough about the show now though and lets get to the story and characters. I loved Maya. I love a strong female role and we actually get a couple in this story with Maya and her mother in law, Judith. Both are strong willed who don’t hold a lot love of for each other. In some respects, they are both quite similar in wanting wants best for their families.It’s great to have a strong female/male friendship which Maya and Shane have fought together in the war as well as still being close as civilians. I like how Shane is always keeping an eye out for Maya and he is almost like a big brother. Lets face it, with losing a sister and husband to killers, it’s good to have someone watching out for you.There are so many twists throughout, with lots of secrets and lies. You don’t know who to trust and my heart was racing as Maya gets closer to uncovering the truth. The ending had me go through an array of emotions and even though having watched the show and knowing what was coming, I still felt like I was reliving it for the first time.Fool Me Once is brilliantly written, packed full of tension and fast paced. Just how I like this genre. It has a good cast of characters and is driven at speed by the plot. You will be routing for Maya throughout, although a lot of her actions had me holding my breath and in total awe of her courage and bravery. I loved my first taste of this author’s books and am desperate for more. A thrilling and shocking read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: A fast-paced read that is hard to put down.
reviews.reviewText: The characters are interesting and the story is charged with emotion.Many surprising twists and turns.One of my favourite Cobens!
I just can’t stop reading all of this guys booksAMAZING, are his books kinda alike? Maybe.Will I keep on reading them? OF COURSE
Artikel genau wie beschrieben. Sehr zufrieden damit und auch mit der raschen und komplikationslosen Lieferung.Danke gerne wieder!
